meanings.definition: Used to introduce a nonrestrictive clause or phrase.
meanings.sent1: The book, which was on the shelf, had a red cover.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't decide which dress to wear to the party.
meanings.sent3: The cat, which was actually a robot in disguise, meowed loudly.
meanings.sent4: The stars, which danced in the night sky, mesmerized the onlookers.
meanings.sent5: The old house, which creaked with every step, seemed haunted.

meanings.definition: Used to ask about one or more items from a definite set.
meanings.sent1: Which of the apples is the ripest?
meanings.sent2: Tell me which movie you want to watch tonight.
meanings.sent3: I wonder which of the clouds is the fluffiest.
meanings.sent4: She pondered which path to take in the forest of decisions.
meanings.sent5: Can you show me which button turns on the light?
